channel.title: Adding separate parts to a command
channel.description: Can someone give me a brief tutorial on how to add commands with separate parts? Like how ::items x y works because when ever I try making my own command like that I always get an error like this: [code]java.lang.NullPointerException at net.com.codeusa.net.packethandler.Commands.handlePacket(Commands.java :1003) at net.com.codeusa.io.PacketManager.parsePacket(PacketManager.java:168) at net.com.codeusa.io.Packets.parseIncomingPackets(Packets.java:92) at net.com.codeusa.Engine.run(Engine.java:192) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code] All I am trying to add is a command that adds pkPoitns to a players mainsave. And I'm trying to get the params something like this: ::givepkpoints "nameofplayer" "amount".

item.title: Adding separate parts to a command
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

The split() method, look it up.

Usage: command.split(" ") - splits up the substring into a few parts which are turned into arrays.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding separate parts to a command

item.title: Adding separate parts to a command
item.dc:creator: @Jazzelhawk Jazzelhawk
item.description:
@Jazzelhawk wrote:

Can someone give me a brief tutorial on how to add commands with separate parts? Like how ::items x y works because when ever I try making my own command like that I always get an error like this:

java.lang.NullPointerException at net.com.codeusa.net.packethandler.Commands.handlePacket(Commands.java :1003) at net.com.codeusa.io.PacketManager.parsePacket(PacketManager.java:168) at net.com.codeusa.io.Packets.parseIncomingPackets(Packets.java:92) at net.com.codeusa.Engine.run(Engine.java:192) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
All I am trying to add is a command that adds pkPoitns to a players mainsave. And I’m trying to get the params something like this: ::givepkpoints “nameofplayer” “amount”.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding separate parts to a command
